section.title: Accessing VMs
section.para: Any user can access their own virtual machines. The administrator can access all VMs running in the cloud.
To access a VM through the CloudPlatform UI:

listitem.para: Log in to the CloudPlatform UI as a user or admin.
Click Instances, then click the name of a running VM.

section.para: To access a VM directly over the network:

listitem.para: The VM must have some port open to incoming traffic. For example, in a basic zone, a new VM might be assigned to a security group which allows incoming traffic. This depends on what security group you picked when creating the VM. In other cases, you can open a port by setting up a port forwarding policy. See IP Forwarding and Firewalling.

If a port is open but you can not access the VM using ssh, it’s possible that ssh is not already enabled on the VM. This will depend on whether ssh is enabled in the template you picked when creating the VM. Access the VM through the CloudPlatform UI and enable ssh on the machine using the commands for the VM’s operating system.
If the network has an external firewall device, you will need to create a firewall rule to allow access. See IP Forwarding and Firewalling.
